fields.description:
BUG: review title doesnt get added if you dont go to the edit details screen. 
* create blank review
* add a changeset
* click done
* review page is open with blank title
* click edit details and you can see the correct title
* click done again and its still not on the review page
fields.summary: Review title isn't added if edit details isn't viewed

fields.description:
# Go to https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/reviews
# Choose a Project from the Custom Filter dropdown
# Click the 'Apply Filter' button
# Now decide to remove the Project restriction
# Select all the text in the box, either by click-dragging or triple-clicking, and type backspace. The drop down shows a list of projects, with one selected.
## If you tab to leave the field, the selected value becomes the new value of the field
## If you click outside the list, the field value becomes 'any', which is what you expect
# Now the field is 'any', click apply filter. When the page refreshes the project field has a value again.
fields.summary: Can't clear autocomplete field

fields.description: One of the first question for someone creating a snippet review was *where do I specify the reviewers*. I know snippet reviews are low overhead and the idea is to just send out a link to the reviewers you want to look at it.  However, it would be really nice to have an IM list or email list so a link gets sent out directly on creating the review.
fields.summary: IM or email list for snippet review

fields.description:
what should happen:
* click create review
* add content dialog comes up
* add some content
* click done
* edit details page comes up
* edit details
* click done
* goes to review page in draft state

what does happen:
* click create review
* add content dialog comes up
* add some content
* click done
* goes to review page in draft state
fields.summary: edit details dialog doesnt come up automatically when creating a blank review

fields.description:
When viewed in FishEye standalone mode the table columns do not have enough styling as they assume the presence of the Reviews column.

As a result the last column content align right and slide waaay over to the right hand edge of the screen.

Extend the styling to accommodate this license option.
fields.summary: /browse page wrongly assumes the presence of a Review column

fields.description:
/browse with a Crucible standalone license and /cru with a Fisheye standalone license, and any of their respective descendant pages, currently 404's. We don't make a distinction between a page not being found and it not being able to be accessed.

It would be a better user experience to instead offer an opportunity to upgrade and so gain the access that you apparently are aware of.
fields.summary: Pages from the non-licensed portions of our products should up-sell

fields.description:
The base /browse page from FishEye can be accessed by URL even when there's no valid FishEye license available.
The page navigation is built correctly (there's no source tab) but it doesn't 404, where the pages linked to do so eg /browse/fe

!http://img.skitch.com/20100826-1ud8gswfp6du91gbfbt1t2hg6n.jpg!

!http://img.skitch.com/20100826-q8dmsjqx6byyqpxi34h8in91h2.jpg!

You have to know it exists, but then evaluators all would.
fields.summary: With a Crucible only license the /browse page can still be accessed

fields.description:
Inline Dialogs that show up when clicking on stars is worthless. We should remove star dialogs entirely, and always provide stars with a meaningful name.

Dialogs were provided as a way to rename a star - we could support inline editing of stars from the favourites page instead.
fields.summary: We should get rid of inline dialogs for stars

fields.description:
When I have only myself "starred", I get other people's review activity on my dashboard.

In addition to this, when "show my activity" is deselected, I still get my own commits appearing.
fields.summary: Activity Stream is wrong

fields.description:
The parser is very aggressive, we'd like to scale it back by being able to control the regular expression it uses to find matching issues.

For example an expression like, [^charlist][projectkey]-\d+. So that partial matching crucible keys will not be picked up. (eg. JIRA-1 and CR-JIRA-1) This would also be helpful when a key number appears in the name of confluence page used in the review objectives. (eg. http://my.confluence.com/display/SPACE/JIRA-258+Some+Description+About+Issue+Key)
fields.summary: JIRA issue key linking matches substrings of URLs, Review keys

fields.description:
If you load the following URI
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/test/plugins/fisheye/fecru-functest-plugin/lib/runtime/xstream-1.3.jar?r1=65927&r2=65927&u=20

The spinner never goes away, even though the content has loaded
fields.summary: Binary file annotation spinner never goes away
make ide link include the line number from frxs

fields.description:
If you delete a binary file it shows up in the changelog with a link to "old version" and "new version". This doesn't make sense - you can't download a file which has been deleted.

Eg: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE?cs=106614
fields.summary: Changeset entry for deleted binary files provides link to download to rev

fields.description:
Since we don't have viewport constrained content in the activity stream, it is frustrating to reach the end of the activity stream and not be able to go back a previous page.

We should add a toolbar with pagination at the bottom of the page.
fields.summary: Add pagination to the bottom of an activity stream

fields.description: We should restrict the height of the sidebar because the filetree can blow out the height of the page
fields.summary: In annotation/diff view, the sidebar should be constrained to the viewport height

fields.description:
With the new annotation view, it is possible to resize the page and have double scrollbars.

We should revert to the previous behaviour and not have full page scrolling on this page anymore.
fields.summary: Fix double scrollbar in annotation view
Write test for RestReviewService
Write test for RestSearchServiceFE

fields.description:
We should still show {{trunk}} before branches - or perhaps ordered by most recently touched.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100824-k9hcakpchj3eaeennc8cf5ifah.jpg!
fields.summary: QuickSearch improvements can be made
Write Test for RestChangesetService

fields.description: See comparison of timings: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~sruiz/Delegate+vs+Live+perf+tests
fields.summary: Investigate and fix ui perf issues

fields.description:
See the screenshot - the no results found entry needs to be styled better. Some padding and removal of the top border

Also, put a "show search results in full page" and "expand search across repos" for the no results display.
fields.summary: [UI] QuickNav no results needs styling

fields.description: Snippets don't have "reviewers" so no one knows about the review unless you tell them.  It would be great if Crucible could also simplify this process.  E.g. have a "notify people about this snippet" button, let you pick some people, click "send".  And these people would get a notification that the snippet is there to be looked at, but wouldn't actually be associated with the review in anyway.
fields.summary: Ability to send a notification to specific people about a snippet

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to give some sort of an overview or description of the snippet that sits at the top of the snippet.
Being able to do this would reduce the clutter in the comments on the right hand side.  As it is if you add more than a couple of comments close together or one extra long comment, they become really hard to associate with their context.
fields.summary: Ability to add description or general comment to a snippet review
add a faster selector for creating an inline comment

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20100823-tcbbfy4h5up9wtbqbq7citgmyy.jpg!
fields.summary: Annotation page legend never loads
Write Test for RestRepositoryServiceFE

fields.description:
for instances with large numbers of repositories and/or projects, the repository list (browse tab) and the project list (the project tab) can have severe performance problems. 

Fix by paginating the list, thus reducing the number of queries needed for the latest activity column.

----
related

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-3083

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2494
fields.summary: paginate the repository list and the project list

fields.summary: [IE] Problems on Snippet Page

fields.description:
Currently, when using an autocomplete dropdown widget, the following system is used:
# Start typing 'sr' into the autocomplete
# Ajax call issued, renders 'Seb Ruiz - sruiz' in the dropdown
# Item selected: input renders 'Seb Ruiz' and a hidden input is given the form value 'sruiz' for submission

Whilst this renders nicely in the UI, it is problematic if the user is too quick. For example I want to type in 'sruiz' quickly and not require the autocomplete, I will be unable to submit a proper form since the hidden input is not given a value without explicit interaction with the autocomplete library.

We should change this to remove the hidden input and put the form value into the input.
fields.summary: [Autocomplete] input fields should take the form value

fields.description: The {{Inbox}} {{Outbox}} and {{Archive}} should be collapsible. The collapse state should be sticky through a cookie preference. If a filter is active in a collapsed section, then the section should be opened (but the preference should not be updated)
fields.summary: [Crucible Inbox] Collapsible headers

fields.description:
This should go in {{test/plugins/fisheye/fecru-functest-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/functestplugin/fisheye}}

It should test all the endpoints in {{RestRevisionDataService}} and be modelled on {{RestSearchServiceTest}}.
fields.summary: Write Test for RestRevisionDataService
Add comment search to API

fields.description:
When using the command line restore option for Crucible and specifying another JDBC URL to restore to, if one parameter is missing then the restore will revert to the DB configuration in {{config.xml}}.

For example, this restore command:

{noformat}./fisheyectl.sh restore -f ../backup/backup_2010-20-08_0755.zip --force --username crucible --password crucible --jdbcurl jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/crucible2{noformat}

Will restore to the configuration in {{config.xml}} because the {{--dbtype postgresql}} is missing.

We should improve the handling of this, and if one of the parameter is missing for an external restore we should warn the user that they're missing a parameter.
fields.summary: Improve restore process when specifying JDBC URL

fields.description: I find *at least* sometimes that when I use n and p to navigate to unread comments, it doesn't work if the comments are on lines that are removed in the latest iteration.  It's pretty annoying.
fields.summary: Next/Previous comment does not navigate to comments in previous iterations of a review

fields.description:
Side By Side diff sometimes doesn't work too well. Wrapping can help this, but its still not ideal. 

It would be nice if there was an option that when you click on a line it can pop up the full text in a unified diff style. Hopefully this explains it better:

fields.description:
When the server is down, comments stay unread when you click on them.

Perhaps we should show an error status in the 'review updated' popup when an Ajax request fails?
fields.summary: Provide an error indication when marking comments as read, if the server is down
